bibl.title: Letter from John R. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, April 1, 1907

div1.p: Kissinger thanks Kelly for his financial support.

div1.head: Letter from John R. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, April 1, 1907
div1.opener:
Dr H A Kelly
1418 Ontario Pl,
Baltimore Md.
April 1. 1907
Dear Doctor:-
div1.p:
Yours of March 26th
was received words could
not exspess my thanks for
the money you sent and
all so for the Intrest you
have shown me.

The money you sent help
us a great (deal and more
then repaid the expence)
for we have not
done as much work as
usual for my wife has
not been in the best of
2
health for the last couple
week and as for my self
I have not felt quite as
well, but they are all
ways sunshine behind
each cloud and I am
thankful I am not any
worse of then what I am
I would not fell quite
so bad if I could take
all the burden up on my
self but as it has placed
burden up on other

I have some, (and have
found some) very kind
friend and we would
3
not have knowing what
to have done with out
them and it has,
taught me to be kind
to all that has misfortunes
If you wish a couple
more picture I will
send them to you

I will thand you
agan and remain
div1.closer:
your sincerelly John R Kissinger 606 E Keasey St
South Bend
Ind.
